page.title: 18WELDING AT CHILTON CANTELO.
page.content: The firm of Adberweld is a crane hire and welding business. They own nine cranes and each can lift a certain weight. The smallest crane lifts a load of 6 tonnes, 4 others lift 15 tonnes, 3 more lift 25 tonnes and the biggest is capable of lifting 30 tonnes. To hire the smallest crane it is Â£12 an hour. The sheds of the firm used to be part of a farm. The steel they weld with comes from firms in Bristol and South Wales. Most of the other materials used come from a Yeovil firm. In one year they use about 1500 tonnes of steel. When they paint any metals they use red oxide to prevent rusting. After this process the object can be painted any colour. Mr. and Mrs. Giles run the firm and employ 20 people. About 6 of these work on building sites. The workers have 26 days a year holiday.
